iati-activity.iati-identifier: GB-COH-03122495-A2119 Women 's Integrated Sexual Health (WISH) Evaluation

description.narrative: DFID is significantly scaling-up its support to global Family Planning (FP) 2020 agreement by funding an ambitious, flagship programme known as Women's Integrated Sexual Health (WISH)The overall intended impact of WISH is progress towards universal sexual and reproductive health rights [SDGs 3.7 and 5.6]. The intended outcome is to enable women in target countries to safely plan their pregnancies and improve their sexual and reproductive health, including the young and marginalised

The aim is to develop a robust evidence base of the impact of UK sexual and reproductive health interventions in Africa and Asia. The overall intended impact of WISH is to contribute to a world in which every mother can enjoy a wanted and healthy pregnancy and childbirth, every child can survive beyond their fifth birthday, and every woman, child and adolescent can thrive to realise their full potential, resulting in enormous social, demographic and economic benefits.
Committed indicative budget from DFID for entirety of the project

receiver-org.narrative: Total maximum budget allocation for project per contract
